page.title: 08Leisure and Recreation.
page.content: The large open spaces of water known as the Flashes, have been formed as a result of subsidence due to brine pumping.they are now used for a full range of water sports.there is a Council run Marina, as well as a privately owned Sailing Club which has over 200 members who travel from a radius of 30 miles.Wind surfing is becoming increasingly popular.Fishing is a widely practised sport. A sports complex was opened in Dec. 1973.It contains a 25 metre pool and a 25 metre learner swimming pool.There are also 3 squash courts with full changing facilities.
